content: Is virtualbox necessary? I want to contribute to zulip; can I just clone the directory on a virtual environment and start working?
Hi @Rohan B and thank you so much for your interest in contributing to Zulip! Lemme look.
@Rohan B So here's what we recommend, which you've probably seen: https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-overview.html#for-os-x
And that does require Vagrant, and "Install VirtualBox or (for better performance; Virtualbox is quite slow) VMWare Fusion with the VMWare Fusion Vagrant plugin."
@Rohan B There's also an experimental Docker approach https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install-docker-dev.html which you're welcome to try! But we won't be able to help you as well.

Now, if you are doing something that does not require you to actually be able to test or run the code, then you don't have to set up a VM! But most of the time you will want to be able to run or test the code, which is why we recommend the setup we do.
[I got confused because you had posted here, in the OSX topic. I thought you were on a Mac.]
